title: Google addresses Pixel 4a battery performance, offers free replacements or compensation - Mint
summary:
Google Addresses Pixel 4a Battery Performance with Replacement Offers

Publication Date: January 8, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Google has started to roll out a software update for Pixel 4a smartphones, aiming to enhance battery performance stability while also offering compensation options for affected users.

  • The update introduces new battery management features targeting improved stability.
  • Affected devices may experience reduced battery capacity and slower charging speeds.
  • Users can opt for either a free battery replacement or financial compensation of $50 or $100 towards new Pixel devices.
  • Replacement services will be available at authorized centres in various countries, including the US, UK, and India.
  • The update will be automatically installed on devices, with a deadline for compensation claims set for January 8.
“This marks the final software update for the Pixel 4a, highlighting the challenges faced by ageing devices.”

This update seeks to balance long-term performance with user satisfaction as the Pixel 4a reaches the end of its software support cycle.
newTitle: Google Addresses Pixel 4a Battery Performance with Replacement Offers

title: Apple's inaccurate AI news alerts shows the tech has a growing misinformation problem - CNBC
summary:
Apple's inaccurate AI news alerts shows the tech has a growing misinformation problem

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: CNBC

This article discusses how Apple's AI news alert feature has been generating false news notifications, raising alarms about the reliability of AI in disseminating information. Recently, erroneous notifications concerning the PDC World Darts Championship and Rafael Nadal were sent to users, prompting concerns from news organizations like the BBC.

  • Apple's AI feature inaccurately reported that Luke Littler had won the Darts Championship before the final took place.
  • An unrelated notification falsely claimed that Rafael Nadal came out as gay.
  • The BBC has sought to rectify issues with Apple's AI-generated news summaries after previous inaccuracies.
  • The company stated it is working on updates to clarify when notifications come from Apple Intelligence.
  • Experts highlight the broader problem of AI-generated misinformation known as 'hallucinations.'
“Apple Intelligence features are in beta and we are continuously making improvements with the help of user feedback.”

In conclusion, as Apple tries to enhance its notification experience, the reliance on AI technology illustrates the delicate balance between innovation and accuracy in the digital age.
newTitle: Apple's AI News Alerts Raise Misinformation Concerns

title: Iyer Brothers drew from a vast repertoire of compositions at their veena concert - The Hindu
summary:
Iyer Brothers Showcase Rich Veena Repertoire at Margazhi Festival

Published: January 08, 2025 05:28 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Iyer Brothers, Ramnath and Gopinath, delivered a remarkable concert at the Kartik Fine Arts Margazhi festival 2024, showcasing their expertise and diverse repertoire of veena compositions.

  • The concert featured compositions such as Pallavi Gopala Iyer’s challenging Thodi varnam.
  • Muthuswamy Dikshitar’s ‘Mahaganapatim’ captivated with its swarakalpana section.
  • The brothers displayed their distinct techniques learned from renowned tutors.
  • The evening's main attraction was a Kalyani raga performance of ‘Etavunara’.
  • The recital concluded with Lalgudi Jayaraman's thillana in Mishra Shivaranjani.
“The brothers possess a vast repertoire, thanks to their tutelage under stalwarts such as R. Pichumani Iyer and Trivandrum R. Venkataraman.”

The Iyer Brothers' performance not only highlighted their technical skills but also their ability to engage the audience, reinforcing their reputation in the world of classical music.
newTitle: Iyer Brothers Showcase Rich Veena Repertoire at Margazhi Festival

summary:

The math at the heart of venture capital is out of whack, with successful exits becoming extremely rare.

  • Successful exits for founders and early investors are increasingly scarce.
  • Challenges for startups to go public contribute to this downturn.
  • The current regulatory climate is unfavorable for large mergers and acquisitions.
"Successful exits, the transactions that let founders and early investors cash out with significant gains, have become vanishingly few and far between."

In light of these challenges, the venture capital industry needs to rethink its strategies to adapt.

title: OnePlus 13 series smartphones first to support Jio 5.5G network in India; offers over 1 Gbps download speed - The Indian Express
summary:
OnePlus 13 series smartphones first to support Jio 5.5G network in India; offers over 1 Gbps download speed

Publication Date: Tuesday

Source: Indian Express

OnePlus launched its new flagship smartphones, the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, which are the first in India to support the Jio 5.5G network, facilitating download speeds exceeding 1 Gbps.

  • OnePlus 13 series is the first to incorporate Jio's upgraded Component Carrier Aggregation (3CC) 5G technology.
  • Speed demonstration showed a jump from 277.78 Mbps on regular 5G to 1,014.86 Mbps on Jio 5.5G.
  • 5.5G technology enables connections to multiple network cells simultaneously for enhanced performance.
  • No additional settings are needed for accessing the 5.5G network with compatible devices.
“Cutting-edge 5.5G technology allows your OnePlus 13 series device to connect to three different network cells, possibly even on different towers at the same time, for faster connectivity and better overall performance.” - James Paterson, Senior Global PR Manager, OnePlus

This advancement in mobile technology promises significantly faster download speeds and improved reliability for users in India.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Series Launches with Jio 5.5G Support in India

The article discusses Xbox's intention to improve the Windows operating system in response to the growing competition from Valve's Steam OS in the handheld gaming sector.

  • Valve's Steam OS will be device agnostic, allowing for a wider range of compatibility.
  • Microsoft's Jason Ronald emphasizes merging Xbox's usability into Windows for enhanced gaming experiences.

title: Samsung’s ‘AI Subscription’ plan for phones, tablets is coming next month - SamMobile - Samsung news
summary:
Samsung's 'AI Subscription' plan for phones, tablets is coming next month

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Samsung News

Samsung has announced that it will start its AI subscription plan next month, allowing users to rent Galaxy smartphones and tablets instead of purchasing them outright.

  • The subscription plan is named 'AI Subscription Club' and focuses on devices with AI features.
  • This information was shared at CES 2025 by Samsung's Vice Chairman Han Jong-hee.
  • Similar to media streaming services, users can subscribe to devices on a monthly basis.
  • Samsung's new model follows a successful subscription service for home appliances in South Korea, which saw significant sales growth.
  • Ballie, an AI-powered companion robot, will be offered through this subscription plan in South Korea.
“We will apply the subscription service to Galaxy smartphones starting next month. Ballie will be introduced first in Korea and the US, and we plan to supply it as a subscription in Korea.” - Han Jong-hee, Samsung Electronics Vice Chairman

The AI subscription model represents a shift in how consumers interact with technology, allowing more flexibility and access to advanced devices.

title: Apple to improve AI news alerts feature after BBC complaint - The Hindu
summary:
Apple to Improve AI News Alerts Feature After BBC Complaint

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: Reuters

Apple has announced plans to improve its AI news alerts feature following complaints about inaccurate summaries, particularly highlighted by incidents involving incorrect news alerts.

  • The AI news alerts feature has faced criticism for summarizing news inaccurately, leading to misinformation being disseminated.
  • Specific examples include incorrect alerts regarding a murder suspect and false claims about tennis player Rafael Nadal.
  • Apple plans to roll out a software update in the coming weeks to clarify the summaries generated by Apple Intelligence.
  • The feature is currently in beta, available on iPhone 16, 15 Pro, 15 Pro Max, and some iPads and Macs.
  • Users are encouraged to report any concerns or inaccurate alerts they encounter.
“Apple is developing a software update to ‘further clarify’ these news alerts summaries generated by Apple Intelligence.”

In conclusion, Apple is taking steps to address the issues with its AI-powered news alerts in response to user feedback and complaints, emphasizing the importance of accurate information dissemination.
newTitle: Apple to Enhance AI News Alerts Following BBC Complaints
